poem:
**Market Contradictions**

Amidst the clangor  
of silent machines,  
orders fall to dust—  
an echo of lost labor.  
  
Yet the FTSE soars,  
a phoenix on paper wings,  
rising from the ash  
of manufactured dreams.  
  
Hands toil empty,  
while numbers sing  
in digital harmony—  
unseen realities.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK manufacturers hit by largest drop in orders since 2020; FTSE 100 hits record high – as it happened 4.48pm BST Closing post And finally…. Britain’s stock market has ended the day at a new high. The FTSE 100 share index has posted a new closing high of 9578.5 points, after new US sanctions on Russia drove up the value of UK energy companies. This takes its gains so far this year to over 17%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: UK manufacturers hit by largest drop in orders since 2020; FTSE 100 hits record high – as it happened 4.48pm BST Closing post And finally…. Britain’s stock market has ended the day at a new high. The FTSE 100 share index has posted a new closing high of 9578.5 points, after new US sanctions on Russia drove up the value of UK energy companies. This takes its gains so far this year to over 17%
